WRITING.TITLE: Exactly how influential is Fox News on the electorate?
WRITING.TEXT:
Neoliberals prefer evidence-based policy and discussion.
Why does it seem that the impression of many neoliberals concerning Fox News is totally out of whack with the *evidence* of the power and reach of Fox News (the evidence is 1) the ratings, and 2) viewer demographics.)
It is not uncommon for my neoliberal friends to ascribe all manner of ills to Fox News. They say "the influence of Fox News CANNOT be overstated." (why, yes, it can.) I also know of another quite well-educated and articulate person who is convinced that "over half the country only gets its news from Fox News." If that were true, then Fox News would have a viewership base of 150 million people!
The way I see it, Fox News has a viewership of about 3 million people, the vast majority, if not all, of them are right wing conservatives anyway. Fox News is not "influencing" -- and certainly not brainwashing -- any liberal, moderate, or undecided voters. Furthermore, these 3 millions of viewers amount to less than 1% of the U.S. population. MTV in the 1980's reached a higher percentage of viewers than that! (I bring up MTV since it WAS a genuine cultural phenomenon in the 1980's.)
Am I wrong? What are your evidence-based thoughts?

One point of confusion is that the definition of "conservative" changes over time. On the other hand, the specific, finite, ideology represented in NR (tax cuts, anti-Communism, states rights, etc.) actually has a specific name, namely "movement conservatism." Movement conservatism is indeed dying or is already dead.
Meanwhile, the term "conservative" lives on, and shorn of even the feeblest ideological pretense, morphs into "drrr whatever Trump wants do to today . . . "

WRITING.TEXT:
A lot of my fellow lefties complain about gerrymandering. Gerrymandering has been around for centuries but has gotten a lot more "efficient" because of computer technology.
If the Democrats/liberals can re-capture some state legislatures and governor seats by 2020 they can gerrymander their own Democrat-friendly district maps for the entire decade of the 2020's -- and presumably the computer software we can use in 2021 will be even more powerful than the software the GOP used in 2011.
Is this the wrong way to think about the issue?
